title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Albany

content.rendered:
Albany is the capital city of New York State. Downtown’s huge Empire State Plaza has reflecting pools, and The Egg, a striking performing arts center. The city’s an up-and-coming tourist center, offering so much more than we can expect. The city encompasses fine dining, cultural attractions, and is right on the doorstep of the Adirondack Mountains. If you want to hike in the summer or ski in the winter, Albany can serve as the perfect base! Let’s dive into the basics: average rent, top neighborhoods and cheap rooms for rent in Albany.

Getting to know Albany

As a state capital, you would expect Albany to have abundant museums and other cultural attractions, and the city never fails to delivers. Geographically, you’d see Albany is dominated by the Hudson River. Thus, it’s a great place to start river cruises. It’s perfect place to live in, and worry not, we’ll assist you in finding cheap rooms for rent in Albany! Come along as we show you all the things you need to know to enjoy this fun-filled city.

Finding rooms for rent in Albany

The average rent in Albany is $1,302. The average size for rooms for rent in Albany, NY is around 849 square feet. However, this number fluctuates greatly depending on unit type with cheap and luxury alternatives for houses and apartments alike.

If you’re looking for affordable neighborhoods, we’ve got that covered too! You can find cheap rooms for rent in Albany in Historic Pastures, Kenwood and Lincoln Park where the average rent goes for $959/month.

Find Rooms for Rent in Albany
  • Troy: Located a few miles north of Albany, Troy is a smaller city with a rich trove of historical sights. It’s famous as the birthplace of the poem “the Night Before Christmas”. Additionally, Troy has great attractions like a child-friendly Science Museum, the Waterfront Farmers Market, and the Burden Iron Works.
  • Downtown Albany: New York State’s capitol, Empire State Plaza, the New York State Museum, and the stores on Lark Street are some of the highlights in this popularly historic neighborhood. If living around museums and architecture makes you excited, Downtown is the place to be.
  • Pine Hills: Just northwest of the city center, Pine Hills is a green, prosperous part of town. Moreover, it features Washington Park, the city’s largest green space, the Albany Institute of History and Art, and great restaurants like Paesan’s and the Ginger Man.

Related: 5 Minimalist Bedroom Wall Art Ideas You Need In Your Life

Average rent in Albany

Studio apartments are the smallest and most affordable, 1-bedroom apartments are closer to the average. And further, 2-bedroom apartments and 3-bedroom apartments offer more generous square footage.

University life in Albany

This urban setting might be best suited for students who like the fast-paced city life. Most universities offer on-campus housing, where you can choose to live in dorms as well. But if you’re looking for rooms for rent in Albany, we’ll help you ease the process of finding the best universities in Albany. Here a breakdown of the top 5 universities and average cost of living in Albany.

Top Universities in Albany

  • University at Albany
  • Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute
  • Skidmore College
  • Union College – New York
  • Albany College of Pharmacy & Health Sciences

Average Cost of Living

Related: Tips On How To Save Money For Everyone

How transit-friendly is Albany?

1. Taxi

Taxis are a good way to get around Albany, which operates a zonal fare system (not a uniform table of rates). Because of this, it makes sense to double check any fares before you leave. Further, beware of crossing the city line, as this may incur higher final fares.

2. Public Transportation

In Albany, CDTA’s public transportation network is limited to buses, but they are a useful way to get around. Single fares are $1.50 ($4 for a day pass), and be aware that the weekend services can be extremely limited.

3. Car

Albany is a fantastic place to rent a car. Not only can you get around town easily, but it opens up the whole Hudson Valley and the Adirondacks and Catskills for exploration. Car rental outlets in town include Hertz, Avis, and Enterprise, and typical rates are around $15-20 per day for smaller models.

4. Bike share

With CDPHP Cycle, rent a bicycle (for $5 an hour) and ride it all around the region — if you can get that far. You’ll find these bike stations throughout the Capital Region. Here’s a list of locations.

Related: Rules To Set In Apartments For Rent With Roommates

Cultural activities in Albany

The town itself always rewards those who live there, with the stunning New York State Capitol building and the elegant storefronts of Main Street. But there’s so much more!

Whale Watching

Albany was home to this country’s last operating Whaling Station, and it’s not hard to see why. The area plays host to Humpback and Southern Right whale migrations from May to October every year, with fantastic viewing spots all along the coast line of the area.

National ANZAC Centre

The National ANZAC Centre is a state-of-the-art museum blending multimedia. It displays interactive exhibits and historical artifacts examining the Australian and New Zealand forces that served in World War I.

Bluff Knoll

If you’re seeking an adventure and some magnificent views, Bluff Knoll is for you! As the highest point in the South West, Bluff Knoll is a very popular spot. As a rite of passage for many West Australians, it’s a fun experience given the lack of big mountain ranges in the state.

Nightlife in Albany

From trivia nights and cornhole tournaments with locals, to handcrafted cocktails at a hidden speakeasy, there is no shortage of things to do in Albany once the sun goes down.

  • Head down to the emerging Warehouse District and discover Albany’s booming craft beverage industry. Explore craft beverage producers from the Capital Craft Beverage Trail.
  • Cheers with handcrafted cocktails at a hidden speakeasy or cozy gastropub. Grab a Spirit of Albany cocktail!
  • If live music is more your scene, catch a performance at a variety of venues in downtown Albany. The night is yours!

While living in Albany, the city offers a variety of things to do once night falls.

When you’re done hunting for rooms for rent in Albany, don’t forget to explore and enjoy the city. Albany is filled with stunning beaches, rich marine life, incredible national parks and a wonderfully historical township to explore, indeed there’s plenty to love in and around this southern gem. So get going, and live your best life in Albany!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Albany? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
